Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD decision, credibility assessment, procedural fairness, state protection
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, documentary evidence, country condition reports
Legal_Provision: Definition of Convention refugee and person in need of protection
Basis_of_Claim: Persecution based on religion (Shia Muslim in Pakistan)
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Credibility issues, delay in claiming refugee status, failure to rebut state protection presumption
Proceeding_Type: Refugee claim and subsequent judicial review
Application_Error: Failure to provide consistent testimony and timely application
Review_Outcome: RPD decision upheld as not patently unreasonable
Legal_Standard: Burden of proof on claimant to establish refugee status or need for protection
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Definition of Convention refugee
Cause_of_Refusal: Inconsistent testimony, delayed claim, failure to rebut state protection
Procedural_Fairness: Alleged breach raised but not substantiated
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review challenging RPD decision on credibility and procedural grounds
Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada - Federal immigration and refugee law
Procedural_Issue: Alleged lack of procedural fairness in RPD hearing
Omission_Type: Failure to rebut presumption of state protection
